body_html: @teng-li No, the problem is that all_reduce python code always wraps the input into a list, and then calls the pybind function. So the pybind function sees a list of list of tensors and then throw such error. It is really confusing because users who don't know the implementation details will be very confused since they send in a list of tensors, and the error message says that its type doesn't match a list of tensors.

body: @teng-li No, the problem is that `all_reduce` python code always wraps the input into a list, and then calls the pybind function. So the pybind function sees a list of list of tensors and then throw such error. It is really confusing because users who don't know the implementation details will be very confused since they send in a list of tensors, and the error message says that its type doesn't match a list of tensors.
